Reviews.Title: “barely fine”
Reviews.Author: hafsa777734
Reviews.Content: the hotel looks nice and cheap compared to other ones. but its somehow in a remote area, u need a taxi in and out to reach the closest places. even the metro , u will have to walk for 15 minutes, and in that weather and sun, no way. the room didnt have any nice view, i think non of the rooms are, the hotel is surronded by many other buildings and many of them are still under sontruction. not the view i aim at. the food i ordered in room service was great. the staff seem friendly but not sure what they are doing. one day i came back with many shopping bags, two door men offered to help me get them up to the room to which i was happy, i went up the room and waited for almost 10-15 minutes. when nothing happened i called in the reception, she said sure they ar eon the way and they know my room, i waited for another 10 minutes and had to call again demanding to get my stuff, still after another 10 minutes i got them. i have been into many hotels and this never happened to me, i dont like my stuff kept away form me for such an unexplanable time. cleanliness, the room seemed clean, but on my second day i found that nothing really was ever cleaned in the bathroom, there was an ear cotton tip that i missed, and i found it there still, it remained there till the day i left although the bathroom was supposed to be cleaned. some of the aminities like a new q-tip and stuff, although i left the box open and empty for them to re-fill, they didnt, simply closed it again as if i wont discover it, i really dont know what did they expected. there is a hair dresser and a spa, dresser was really good, didnt use the spa. some restuarants and night clubs were there and i would assume they are goo as i wlays found them booked. final thing is that i was in the 5th floor and every night i will have to bear with the noise coming from these night clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back”
Reviews.Author: EduardoBadgo
Reviews.Content: Nice location if you had a business near media city or Marina , also near to Metro station

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncpereira
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay 3/4 days, big and clean rooms and bathrooms, good braekfast, staff was nice, easy to get cabs to go arrond, bad is to pay intrnet in this days

Reviews.Title: “nice, interesting place to stay for solo/ business travellers...”
Reviews.Author: SoumitreeG
Reviews.Content: wanted to stay in the tecom area and hence booked this place on the basis of the past reviews from TA...not too disappointed with it, would seriously consider coming back to this. Plus sides; 1. my pre-booked room wasnt available so i was upgraded to a suite. huge room with nice fittings and excellent bathroom 2. book with the breakfast buffet - worth it. 3. nice swimming pool and the spa...try the massage 4. has a 24X7 room service to order anything-anytime 5. the english pub does hve pretty waitresses and ncie liquor 6. the in-house night-club 'The Chameleon' - even though a noisy affair, brought a certain amount of 'color' to the place :) 7. the overall atmosphere of the hotel is pretty fun and colorful! easy to get cabs too at most times of the day. minus sides: 1. pls include internet in the room rates - looks ridiculous when u sell internet hrs separately. should be made free for certain room kinds 2. my minibar was empty when i checked-in, had to remi^nd them to fill it up 3. billing takes long (in the morning during checkout) and i had errors in my bill when the internet - for which i had paid cash - was again added to the bill. also, when i pre-book thru the net in another currency - the convertability in that booked currency should be displayed and not just the AED price. overall: would i come back? yes, i would.

Reviews.Title: “Going back”
Reviews.Author: RForbesRobertson
Reviews.Content: Recently working in Dubai and this hotel was suggested for convenience and price. It scored on both. Standard huge buffet breakfast included. But really stupid charges for internet, I really resent this sort of rip off - and that's what it is. Large 'English' pub with attractive waitresses wearing very tight shirts and Burberry minskirts. But great beer. It gets very noisy in the evening but the girl singer /saxophonist is astoundingly good. I'll be back for the beer and the singer

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UllasgShah
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very spacious and newly constructed I booked this hotel on the reviews of other reviewers & was not the least bit disappointed.We loved the hotel,the staff was very helpful,the room was very clean.We loved the location in Dubai. It is very near to Metro Station. So it is very easy to get to everything.We also enjoyed having the complimentary breakfast. I would definitely stay there again if we ever go back to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and amazibg location”
Reviews.Author: Farhanesar
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for a week. The overall experience was good. The room size is good and so is the bathroom. The swimming pool was of decent size. The suana room was small as comparwd to other hotels. The lift were slow and a new lift was being installed.the breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “nightclub noise”
Reviews.Author: latte225
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at Byblos for business and it is very close to my office so that was great. The night manager is a lovely man and very friendly however the noise level is something else in the hotel. There is a nightclub on the penthouse and I spent my first night trying to sleep at 1am however I couldn't due to the thump thump thump of the music and I was on the 11th floor. The nightclub is open until 3am. I got moved on the second night to the 3rd floor however I can still hear the thump thump thump albeit not as loud. Also it now sounds like I have an airconditioning unit next door as when I turn it off I can still hear the noise as if it was on full blast. Breakfasts are fine, bed is very clean and the staff are lovely but don't stay here if you are on holiday as it is just not the right place for that

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an ideal business location”
Reviews.Author: olsontowers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Byblos, and while the foyer was being refurbished at the time, it had very little impact on us. The rooms were ideal, large, well furnished with comfortable beds. The only issue was the meeting room that was booked had been double booked and we had to make use of a smaller one for a couple of days. The staff we came in contact with were very eager to please, esoecially in the restaurant for breakfast. I'd recommend the hotel to others. For the quality vs. price, I'd say it was bang on. Don't expect it to be 5* because it's not. What it is though, is a good 4* operation. also has easy access to Sheikh Zayed Rd which will get you anywhere in Dubai very quickly. Concierge will hail you a cab at all times of day and night!!

Reviews.Title: “needs a service review”
Reviews.Author: otooles
Reviews.Content: Good room, great location for that particular trip but service needs an overhaul....no-one knew that the wifi was chargeable....the bane of business travellers lives...too ken to point out what was chargeable, a business rather than a vocation . just add a couple of bucks to the bill and give us free wifi..... no smoking in bars woufl be a great help having said that, excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Nipun_11
Reviews.Content: I want to comment on the excellent service offered to me during my stay in your hotel. The room was comfortable and B/fast was nice Nipun Bhola Manager – E Markets Central Reservations Office Elite Hospitality , Kingdom of Bahrain Tel : + 973 - 17558200 Fax : + 973 - 17550817 Mobile : + 973 - 36216888 Email : nipun@elitegroup4u.com Web : www.elitegroup4u.com

Reviews.Title: “Had to write this to inform the unaware........”
Reviews.Author: domb1976
Reviews.Content: The Byblos is marketed as a business class hotel. First impression was a very very disorganised front desk. it would have been comical except I was a paying guest. I should have realised the error of my ways when a Chinese resident was trying to ask for something in poor English, the receptionist just couldn't be bothered to try and understand his needs and practically ignored him whilst she did something else. My own check-in person (who was Russian) was so cold and matter of fact about things I thought I was in Russia! Room decor was appropriate for the hotel class, but then I noticed I'd been given a smoking room that stank of stale cigarettes, when I spoke to the Russian receptionist to change rooms, she informed me that there are only 2 designated non smoking floors for the whole hotel (hotel has at least 16 floors) which I guess is a great ratio if you are a smoker, and I got the clear impression my Russian girl was saying I should start smoking......she begrudgingly offerred to send house-keeping to spray air freshner.....he came promptly was a nice kid, but he used some weapons grade fumicide spray or something that really iritated my throat, and guess what the windows don't open... There was a constant banging and drilling going on somewhere nearby, very annoying. Next thing, connecting to the internet was a nightmare, same Russian girl again, told me what to do but sternly warned me there was an hourly charge, fine I said, alas, it didn't work, you had to enter your room number which it promptly said didn't exist....so Russian girl said she would send up an 24hr internet voucher but, she warned me would cost AED100, fine I said, I just needed to do some work. 30 mins later I decided to go down to front desk to get it myself, where I had to sign for the crappy internet voucher before getting it, I thought I would mention the civil engineering work on-going in the room next door, to which Russian girl replied, Oh its ok they should be finished by 18.00 it their end of shift!! I then asked for my passport back as I wanted to go out (passport is required to be scanned on arrival), however they were so disorganised when i checked in they said they would do it and return it later.....guess what I'm still waiting for it as I write this review. My booking is room only so no breakfast included, anywhere else i've stayed would have been upgraded or comped for that at least. Positives, clean room (apart from the stale cigarette smoke)

Reviews.Title: “Too Far from Every Where”
Reviews.Author: Mohsen26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Byblos hotel for 6 nights in Nov 2010. check in was friendly and speedy Room Service was good Room Designed very well,good Air Condition and lightings. The Internet connection is too Expensive and disappointing , The Traditional English Bar is boring for me but better than nothing. You should walk 10 min in dusty ways to Metro Station. The Taxis doesn't known the Byblos hotel. You should notice them to take you to Tecom Area. You should pay a lot of money for taxi because this hotel is to far from every where The View is too bad; Just Under construction buildings. the Pool is a fake Tank ( very small 2m X 5m, max Depth 1M) Break Fast was Ok , Egg, Fruits , Sausage, Cereals , Cookies, Milk , Fruit Juice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but the pub - oh dear”
Reviews.Author: laidbackcyclist
Reviews.Content: A well appointed and modern hotel. The rooms are of a high standard, as is the bathroom - the only mild complaint was the rather cyclical water temperature in the shower. Nice touches like the electronic control panel. I ate in the Italian - average to good quality but expensive, and I had room service, which was good value and flavour. and delivered quickly. Breakfast in the cafe on the 1st floor is pretty good. There is a very small gym on the second floor. The trainer attached to the club spends all his time in there watching tv, which can be off putting. The 'traditional British pub' is ghastly. Smoky, noisy, full of a rather brash clientele, Avoid like the plague, and head for the indoor/outdoor bar on the 1st floor. Charging for internet access (15Dhs/hour or 100Dhs/24hr, both valid for 24hours) really annoys me. It should be free in a 1000Dhs a night hotel. In December, the staff were Santa hats and the Christmas decorations go up. I'd rather they didn't bother in an Arabic country.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Vivek_Singh
Reviews.Content: 10 minute walk to Dubai Metro station, the hotel is very well managed. The rooms are neat and well kept. I stayed in an executive room for four days. The rooms are spacious, although no great views. Expect 2-3 kinds of body lotion in small plastic bottles along with ear buds, and shampoo and two face towels. Hot water supply all through. In the closet, shoe horn and sponge was kept. They can even shine the shoes for you, if you wish. Breakfast was lovely. Good selection of fruits, dry fruits and cereals and eggs. They expect you to pay full money on arrival, else deposit your passport. I had to call at least 5 times to get an iron in the room. But, once it arrived, the housekeeping guy was very nice and he fixed every thing. Even put a flat sheet on the ironing board. Be ready to pay 15 dirhams for one hour internet. Will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and very well appointed hotel but bad food”
Reviews.Author: DerbysTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Byblos hotel for three nights in late June 2010. The hotel is located in the new Dubai area, quite a good location for taxi based access to attractions such as Mall of the Emirates, Ski Dubai, The Marina, Madinat Jumeirah, Wild Wadi, Atlantis etc. The TECOM - Greens area is a quiet area with no immediate amenities, however a short taxi journey (AED10) will find you at the Greens Centre with a small selection of restaurants, pharmacy etc. The hotel offers free valet parking and a friendly yet speedy check in. A new hotel, the rooms are modern yet comfortable with many modern electronic touches such as touch button "do not disturb" facility etc. Easy access high speed wireless Internet is charged at AED15 per hour. The rooms are excellent in almost every way, very much more 5* than 4*. The only minor issue that I could point out was that the sound of water running in the next room's shower could be heard through the walls - not a big issue unless your neighbour likes a shower at 2am...! There is a massage spa, restaurant and 'English Pub' bar on site, although following some unsavoury "stomach-based after-effects" gained from eating a room service meal, I'm not sure I'd recommend sampling the food here. Dubai is full of amazing food opportunities however, and this is a good hotel, - stay here but eat elsewhere would be my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Josau
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to the Internet City Metro station. The staff is helpful and friendly, the rooms are well designed, large and clean. The pool has a decent size and there were hardly any people there, had it almost to myself. The Al Barsha/Tecom area, where the hotel is located, is not the hippest neighbourhood and has still some construction going on, but this didn't disturb the over all good impression I had. I will certainly stay there again. The hotel is suited for business travelers and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BritabroadLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Slightly difficult to locate in Al Barsha district (not far from The Greens) its a new hotel and has very comfortable and spacious rooms. A lively coffee shop (if you like sheesha outdoors) and a busy "pub" constitute main entertainment. Staff very helpful. Overall good value for money, and faily near to Mall of Emirates and Madiniaat Jumeirah. Proximity to Sheikh Zayed road makes travel to all parts of Dubai accessible.

HotelInfo.Name: Byblos Hotel Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Al Barsha | P.O.Box 500234, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
